annotation.comment: Improved geodetic latitude of the pixel. Units are in degrees north of the equator.
Improved geodetic longitude of the pixel. Positive=degrees east of the Prime Meridian. Negative=degrees west of the Prime Meridian.
Improved height of the pixel above the reference ellipsoid.

annotation.long_name: identifier of the associated prior river reach
annotation.comment: Unique reach identifier from the prior river database. The format of the identifier is CBBBBBRRRT, where C=continent, B=basin, R=reach, T=type.

annotation.long_name: identifier of the associated prior river node
annotation.comment: Unique node identifier from the prior river database. The format of the identifier is CBBBBBRRRNNNT, where C=continent, B=basin, R=reach, N=node, T=type of water body.

Climatological ice cover flag indicating whether the node is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on external climatological information (not the SWOT measurement). Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the node is not ice covered, partially ice covered, and fully ice covered, respectively. A value of 255 indicates that this flag is not available.

Dynamic ice cover flag indicating whether the surface is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on analysis of external satellite optical data. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the node is not ice covered, partially ice covered, and fully ice covered, respectively. A value of 255 indicates that this flag is not available.
Index of the data in the pixel_cloud group of the L2_HR_PIXC file that is associated with the pixel. This index starts counting from zero.

annotation.flag_meanings: river lake river_under_tide canal no_hydrosheds dam
annotation.comment: Flag indicating the reach from the PRD. 0= Reach was flagged as belonging to a river. 1= Reach was flagged as belonging to a lake. 2= Reach was flagged as a river under the influence of tides. 3= Reach was flagged as being under the influence of a canal. 4= Unable to connect reach with HydroSHEDS topology. 5= Reach was flagged as being under the influence of a dam. A value of 1 can occur for pixels that are associated with a connected lake type (T=3) in the reach_id and node_id.
A unique number of identifying which connected water segment the pixel was assigned to.
Distance from the non-improved pixel location to the PRD node that it is associated with.
Along-reach component of non-improved pixel location relative to PRD node location. Negative=nominally upstream of PRD node. Positive=nominally downstream of PRD node
Cross-reach component of non-improved pixel location relative to PRD node location. Negative= left side of centerline. Positive= right side of centerline.

annotation.description: NetCDF-4 conventions adopted in this product. This attribute should be set to CF-1.7 to indicate that the group is compliant with the Climate and Forecast NetCDF conventions.
Level 2 KaRIn high rate pixel cloud vector river product.
Name of producing agency.

The method of production of the original data. If it was model-generated, source should name the model and its version, as specifically as could be useful. If it is observational, source should characterize it (e.g., 'radiometer').
UTC time when file generated. Format is: 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss : Creation'
Published or web-based references that describe the data or methods used to product it. Provides version number of software generating product.
Name and version of Product Description Document to use as reference for product.
Contact information for producer of product. (e.g., 'ops@jpl.nasa.gov').
Cycle number of the product granule.
Pass number of the product granule.
Tile number in the pass of the product granule.
'L' or 'R' to indicate left and right swath,respectively.

Tile name using format PPP_TTTS, where PPP is a 3 digit pass number with leading zeros, TTT is a 3 digit tile number within the pass, and S is a character 'L' or 'R' for the left and right swath, respectively.
The slant range (m) for the first image pixel.
The range spacing (m) corresponding to the 200 MHz sampling frequency
UTC time of first measurement. Format is: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.ssssssZ
UTC time of last measurement. Format is: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.ssssssZ
Nominal swath corner latitude (degrees_north) for the first range line and inner part of the swath
Nominal swath corner longitude (degrees_east) for the first range line and inner part of the swath
Nominal swath corner latitude (degrees_north) for the last range line and inner part of the swath
Nominal swath corner longitude (degrees_east) for the last range line and inner part of the swath
Nominal swath corner latitude (degrees_north) for the first range line and outer part of the swath
Nominal swath corner longitude (degrees_east) for the first range line and outer part of the swath
Nominal swath corner latitude (degrees_north) for the last range line and outer part of the swath
Nominal swath corner longitude (degrees_east) for the last range line and outer part of the swath
List of water mask pixel cloud files used to generate data in product.
Name of static river a priori database file used to generate data in product.
Semi-major axis of reference ellipsoid in meters.
Flattening of reference ellipsoid
